Bool icmDebugReadProcessorMemory ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  simAddress,
void *  buffer,
Uns32  objectSize,
Uns32  objects,
icmHostEndian  hostEndian 
)

Read a region from the processor address space into native memory, without side effects. When calculating the byte-swap requirements, it uses the processor's DATA endian-ness.

Returns:
True if access was successful. False if any part failed.
Parameters:
processor Processor object.
simAddress Base address of the region to be read.
buffer Pointer to host space to receive the data.
objectSize Number of bytes in each endian-corrected object.
objects Number of objects.
hostEndian Endian-ness of data in host buffer.
void icmDebugThisProcessor ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Add this to the list of processors to attach a debugger (max=1 in OVPsim).

Parameters:
processor Processor handle.
Bool icmDebugWriteProcessorMemory ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  simAddress,
const void *  buffer,
Uns32  objectSize,
Uns32  objects,
icmHostEndian  hostEndian 
)

Write a region from native memory into processor address, without side-effects. When calculating the byte-swap requirements, it uses the processor's DATA endian-ness.

Returns:
True if access was successful. False if any part failed.
Parameters:
processor Processor object.
simAddress Base address of the region to be written.
buffer Pointer to host space containing the data.
objectSize Number of bytes in each endian-corrected object.
objects Number of objects.
hostEndian Endian-ness of data in host buffer.

const char* icmDisassemble ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  simAddr 
)

Call the processor-specific register dump.

Returns:
Disassembly string. This is a static buffer, so will be overwritten by the next call.
Parameters:
processor Processor object.
simAddr Address of instruction to be disassembled. Must be correctly instruction-aligned for a meaningful result.

Addr icmGetPC ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Get the processor program counter.

Returns:

Parameters:
processor Processor object.
Addr icmGetPCDS ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Uns8 *  delaySlotOffset 
)

For processors without delay slots, or for a non-delay-slot instruction of a processor with delay slots, return the processor program counter and set 'delaySlotOffset' to zero. For a delay slot instruction, return the program counter of the preceding jump instruction and set 'delaySlotOffset' to the offset in bytes of the delay slot instruction.

Returns:
Processor program counter.
Parameters:
processor Processor object.
delaySlotOffset Set to offset (in bytes) of the delay slot instruction.

Number of instructions and halted instructions executed, up to now.

void icmInterrupt ( void   ) 

This is the only ICM function that is safe to call in a signal handler. It causes any currently-executing simulation thread to stop as soon as possible in a safe state so that other ICM functions can be called. The stop is signalled by a return code stop reason of ICM_SR_INTERRUPT. The thread stops just before the next code block is executed; typically, this will be a few instructions on from the icmInterrupt call. It is safe to use icmInterrupt in non-signal-handler contexts (e.g. memory callbacks) but you may want to consider the use of icmYield in this context.

void icmInterruptRSP ( void   ) 

Return control to the mpd console from native code - ICM clients should not use this function.

void icmSetAddressBreakpoint ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  simAddress 
)

Set address breakpoint for the processor. When breakpoint address is executed, processor stops execution with stopReason ICM_SR_BP_ADDRESS.

Parameters:
processor Processor on which to set breakpoint.
simAddress Address at which to break.
icmWatchPointP icmSetBusAccessWatchPoint ( icmBusP  bus,
Addr  low,
Addr  high,
void *  userData,
icmMemNotifierFn  notifierCB 
)

Set access watchpoint on address range low:high in bus. When any processor reads or writes an address in that range, it will stop execution with stopReason ICM_SR_WATCHPOINT. Upon halt, all triggered watchpoints need to be processed with icmGetNextTriggeredWatchPoint before simulation is resumed.

Returns:
Watchpoint object created.
Parameters:
bus Memory on which to set watchpoint.
low Low bound of watched range.
high High bound of watched range.
userData Client-specific data pointer.
notifierCB Client-specific notifier.
icmWatchPointP icmSetBusReadWatchPoint ( icmBusP  bus,
Addr  low,
Addr  high,
void *  userData,
icmMemNotifierFn  notifierCB 
)

Set read watchpoint on address range low:high in bus. When any processor reads an address in that range, it will stop execution with stopReason ICM_SR_WATCHPOINT. Upon halt, all triggered watchpoints need to be processed with icmGetNextTriggeredWatchPoint before simulation is resumed.

Returns:
Watchpoint object created.
Parameters:
bus Bus on which to set watchpoint.
low Low bound of watched range.
high High bound of watched range.
userData Client-specific data pointer.
notifierCB Client-specific notifier.
icmWatchPointP icmSetBusWriteWatchPoint ( icmBusP  bus,
Addr  low,
Addr  high,
void *  userData,
icmMemNotifierFn  notifierCB 
)

Set write watchpoint on address range low:high in bus. When any processor reads an address in that range, it will stop execution with stopReason ICM_SR_WATCHPOINT. Upon halt, all triggered watchpoints need to be processed with icmGetNextTriggeredWatchPoint before simulation is resumed.

Returns:
Watchpoint object created.
Parameters:
bus Bus on which to set watchpoint.
low Low bound of watched range.
high High bound of watched range.
userData Client-specific data pointer.
notifierCB Client-specific notifier.

Bool icmSetDebugStopTime ( icmTime  newStopTime  ) 

Set the stop time (for icmSimulatePlatform) - takes effect at the end of any current time slice. icmSimulatePlatform will not return when this stop time is reached, an attached debugger will get control.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
newStopTime The new stop time (see icmTime).
icmWatchPointP icmSetExceptionWatchPoint ( icmProcessorP  processor,
void *  userData,
icmRegNotifierFn  notifierCB 
)

Set exception watchpoint. When the processor takes an exception it will stop execution with stopReason ICM_SR_WATCHPOINT. Upon halt, all triggered watchpoints need to be processed with icmGetNextTriggeredWatchPoint before simulation is resumed.

Returns:
Watchpoint object created.
Parameters:
processor Processor on which to set watchpoint.
userData Client-specific data pointer.
notifierCB Client-specific notifier.
void icmSetICountBreakpoint ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Uns64  delta 
)

Set instruction count breakpoint for the processor that will expire after 'delta' instructions. When instruction count has expired, processor stops execution with stopReason ICM_SR_BP_ICOUNT.

Parameters:
processor Processor on which to set breakpoint.
delta Instruction count after which to stop.

icmWatchPointP icmSetModeWatchPoint ( icmProcessorP  processor,
void *  userData,
icmRegNotifierFn  notifierCB 
)

Set mode change watchpoint. When the processor mode changes (the value returned by icmGetMode differs) it will stop execution with stopReason ICM_SR_WATCHPOINT. Upon halt, all triggered watchpoints need to be processed with icmGetNextTriggeredWatchPoint before simulation is resumed.

Returns:
Watchpoint object created.
Parameters:
processor Processor on which to set watchpoint.
userData Client-specific data pointer.
notifierCB Client-specific notifier.

Addr  simAddr 
)

Set the processor program counter.

Parameters:

simAddr Value loaded into the PC. This function is similar to icmWriteReg, but does not need to know the name of the PC.
void icmSetPSEGdbPath ( icmPseP  processor,
const char *  path,
const char *  flags 
)

Set path to a gdb executable and gdb start-up arguments. This is only required if debugging a PSE.

Parameters:
processor PSE object.
path Path to the GDB executable.
flags Any command line flags required by GDB.
icmWatchPointP icmSetProcessorAccessWatchPoint ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Bool  isPhysical,
Addr  low,
Addr  high,
void *  userData,
icmMemNotifierFn  notifierCB 
)

Set access watchpoint on address range low:high in the processor physical or virtual address space (depending on the setting of 'isPhysical'). When any processor reads or writes an address in that range, it will stop execution with stopReason ICM_SR_WATCHPOINT. Upon halt, all triggered watchpoints need to be processed with icmGetNextTriggeredWatchPoint before simulation is resumed.

Returns:
Watchpoint object created.
Parameters:
processor Processor on which to set watchpoint.
isPhysical True for physical, False for virtual.
low Low bound of watched range.
high High bound of watched range.
userData Client-specific data pointer.
notifierCB Client-specific notifier.
void icmSetProcessorGdbBasic ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Do not use an external GDB for this processor.

Parameters:
processor Processor to use the basic debug functionality.

const char *  flags

Parameters:

flags Optional command line flags.

Set register change watchpoint. When the register value changes in the passed processor, it will stop execution with stopReason ICM_SR_WATCHPOINT. Upon halt, all triggered watchpoints need to be processed with icmGetNextTriggeredWatchPoint before simulation is resumed.

Returns:
Watchpoint object created.

notifierCB Client-specific notifier.

void *  userData 
)

Parameters:

endcb The end schedule function.
userData Pass this in the userData argument.
